Modeling a binary network outcome

Peter Hoff

2020-12-01

Source: vignettes/binary_demo.Rmd
binary_demo.Rmd

Load the library:

library(amen)

Set up the data:

data(lazegalaw)

Y<-lazegalaw$Y[,,2]
Xn<-lazegalaw$X[,c(2,4,5,6)]
Xd<-lazegalaw$Y[,,-2]
Xd<-array( c(Xd,outer(Xn[,4],Xn[,4],"==")),dim=dim(Xd)+c(0,0,1))
dimnames(Xd)[[3]]<-c("advice","cowork","samepractice")

dimnames(Xd)[[3]]
## [1] "advice"       "cowork"       "samepractice"
dimnames(Xn)[[2]]
## [1] "female"    "seniority" "age"       "practice"

plot the network with “practice” denoted by plotting color:

netplot(lazegalaw$Y[,,2],ncol=Xn[,4])

fitSRRM<-ame(Y, Xd=Xd, Xr=Xn, Xc=Xn, family="bin")

summary(fitSRRM) 
##      Length Class  Mode   
## BETA 4800   -none- numeric
## VC   2000   -none- numeric
## APM    71   -none- numeric
## BPM    71   -none- numeric
## U       0   -none- numeric
## V       0   -none- numeric
## UVPM 5041   -none- numeric
## EZ   5041   -none- numeric
## YPM  5041   -none- numeric
## GOF  2005   -none- numeric
fitAME<-ame(Y, Xd=Xd, Xr=Xn, Xc=Xn, R=3, family="bin")

summary(fitAME) 
##      Length Class  Mode   
## BETA 4800   -none- numeric
## VC   2000   -none- numeric
## APM    71   -none- numeric
## BPM    71   -none- numeric
## U     213   -none- numeric
## V     213   -none- numeric
## UVPM 5041   -none- numeric
## EZ   5041   -none- numeric
## YPM  5041   -none- numeric
## GOF  2005   -none- numeric
